channel.title: CounselorAudioSource.Net
channel.description: CounselorAudioSource.Net is a weekly podcast designed for practicing counselor's professional development. CAS features a 20-40 minute interview on topics to assist counselor training and covers a variety of counseling disciplines.

item.title: CAS090 - Response To Intervention model for working with school success w/ Dr. Katherine S. Adams
item.description: Dr. Katherine Adams is interviewed by Dr. Jill Geltner (both assistant professors of Psychology and Counseling at Valdosta State University) regarding the Response To Intervention Model for working with school success. - Runtime 52:20
item.author: jencius@mac.com (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS089 - Dr. Bob Barret - Counselor, counselor educator, father, grandfather, andÂ gay man
item.description: Dr. Bob Barret - Professor Emeritus at University of North Carolina - Charlotte speaks with Sarah Moore and CAS Contributing Editor Dr. Clarrice Rapisarda regarding his life as a gay male counseling professional - Runtime 32:31
item.author: jencius@mac.com (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS088 - Behavior therapy with children w/ Dr. Lynn Clark
item.description: Dr. Lynn Clark - Professor Emeritus at Western Kentucky University speaks with CAS Contributing Editor Dr. Tammy Shaffer regarding teaching parents to use behavior therapy with children - Runtime 43:41
item.author: jencius@mac.com (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS087 - Through the eyes of a child: Working with children and students in poverty w/ Dr. Mary Graham
item.description: Dr. Mary Graham of Seattle University speaks with CAS Contributing Editor Kimberly J. Desmond regarding working with children and students in poverty - Runtime 39:26
item.author: editor@couseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS086 - Applications of Second Life to Education and Counseling w/ Dr. James Lenze and Lloyd Onyett, M.A.
item.description: Dr. James Lenze and Assistant Dean Lloyd Onyett, M.A of Indiana University of Pennsylvania speak with CAS Contributing Editor Kimberly J. Desmond regarding the virtual world of Second Life and its application to education and counseling. - Runtime 53:17
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS085 - Understanding Dreams - A Window into How We Think w/ Dr. Dan Rose
item.description: CAS contributing editor Dr. Michael L. Baltimore interviews Dr. Dan Rose, Counseling Center Director at Columbus State University on the topic of "Dreams". This podcast is an account of Dr. Rose's experience in using dreams to help clients and counselors-in-training. In addition, the video of this podcast can be seen at: http://coe.colstate.edu/tech/Dreams.htm - Runtime 23:56
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS084 - Chemical Dependency Assessment w/ Dr. Andrew Burck
item.description: Dr. Andrew Burck speaks with CAS Contributing Editor Dr. Laura Bruneau regarding chemical dependency assessment - Runtime 23:56
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS083 - Adolescent Chemical Dependency w/ Dr. Bradford Price
item.description: Dr. Bradford Price, Clinical Director at Glenbeigh Treatment Center speaks with CAS Contributing Editor Amy Freadling regarding the recent history and practice of adolescent chemical dependency - Runtime 45:28
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS082 - Elementary School Counseling and the Developmental Approach w/ Dr. Robert D. Myrick
item.description: Dr. Robert D. Myrick, Professor Emeritus from The University of Florida speaks with CAS Contributing Editor Dr. Jill Geltner regarding the history of elementary school counseling and his developmental model of counseling. Runtime 43:51
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS081 - Update on CACREP and the Revised Standards w/ Dr. Jack Culbreth
item.description: Dr. Jack Culbreth speaks with CAS Contributing Editor Dr. Clarrice Rapisarda (both of The University of North Carolina - Charlotte) regarding CACREP and the current standards revision process. Dr. Culbreth is the current Chair of the CACREP Board of Directors. Runtime 38:22
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS080 - Basic Counseling Skills for School Administrators w/ Dr. Tom Hackett
item.description: Dr. Tom Hackett, Chair of Counseling, Educational Leadership and Professional Studies at Columbus State University in Columbus, GA, speaks with CAS Contributing Editor Dr. Michael L. Baltimore (also at Columbus State University) about his experience and thoughts regarding the need for school administrators to have an understanding of basic counseling skills. Runtime 46:42
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS079 - Hurricane Katrina and School Counseling Services w/ Michael Barocco, M.Ed.
item.description: Michael Barocco, a school counselor at Archbishop Rummel High School in Metairie, Louisiana speaks about school counseling two years after the Katrina hurricane. Mr. Barocco is interviewed by CAS Contributing Editor Edina Renfro-Michel of Montclair State University. Runtime 42:07
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS078 - Love and Logic w/ Foster Cline, M.D.
item.description: Dr. Foster Cline is co-founder of the Love and Logic Institute and speaks about the parent training program of Love and Logic with CAS Contributing Editor, Dr. Mark A. Young. Runtime 29:12
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS077 - The School Counselor and Occupational Therapy w/ Teresa Leibforth, Ed.S., NCC, OTR/L
item.description: Teresa Leibforth, Ed.S., NCC, OTR/L speaks with CAS Contributing Editor Dr. Jill Geltner (both associated with The University of Florida) about when school counselors working with occupational therapy issues. Runtime 33:31
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS076 - Priests and Sexuality: Information and Implications for Counselors w/ Jocelyn Gregiore, Ed.D., C.S.Sp.
item.description: Jocelyn Gregiore, Ed.D., C.S.Sp. speaks with CAS Contributing Editor Dr. David Delmonico (both of Duquesne University) about counselors working with priests regarding sexual issues. Runtime 51:36
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS075 - The Practice of Clinical Hypnosis w/ Dr. Dwaine Rice
item.description: Dr. Dwaine Rice of The University of Memphis speaks about his experience and practice of clinical hypnosis in counseling with CAS Contributing Editor Dr. Jeffrey Freiden. Runtime 37:46
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS074 - Forgiveness in Counseling w/ Dr. Nancy Taylor
item.description: Dr. Nancy Taylor of John Carroll University speaks about forgiveness in counseling with CAS Contributing Editor Amy Freadling, M.Ed., PCC-S. Runtime 36:51
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS073 - Self-help Reading w/ Dr. Laura Bruneau
item.description: Dr. Laura Bruneau of Adams State College speaks with CAS Editor Dr. Marty Jencius of Kent State University about her research on self-help reading and what clients found helpful. Runtime 28:36
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS072 - Sports Counseling w/ Dr. Taunya Tinsley
item.description: Dr. Taunya Tinsley speaks with Dr. Jacqueline A. Walsh (both of California University of Pennsylvania) about the emerging field of sports counseling. Runtime 22:55
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS071 - The Center for Counselor Training and Services w/ Dr. John McCarthy
item.description: Dr. John McCarthy speaks with CAS Contributing Editor Dr. Kimberly J. Desmond (both of Indiana University of Pennsylvania) regarding his direction of The Center for Counselor Training and Services at IUP which offer regional workshops to area mental health professionals and graduate students. Runtime 39:50
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS070 - The School Counselor and Accountability w/ Dr. Larry C. Loesch
item.description: Dr. Larry C. Loesch speaks with contributing editor Dr. Jill A. Geltner (both of The University of Florida) about accountability in school counseling. Runtime 51:30
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS069 - Stress Management w/ Dr. Robert C. Nielsen
item.description: Dr. Robert C. Nielsen speaks with contributing editor Dr. Jill Nelson (both of North Dakota State University) about the stress management for clients and counselors. Runtime 34:34
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS068 - Grief Counseling and Crisis Response w/ Dr. Peggy Whiting
item.description: Dr. Peggy Whiting speaks with contributing editor Dr. Chadwick Royal (both of North Carolina Central University) about the grief counseling and crisis response. Their conversation reflects on the recent tragic shootings at Virginia Tech. Runtime 33:11
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS067 - Counseling the Gifted Child w/ Dr. Jean Peterson
item.description: Dr. Jean Peterson of Purdue University speaks with contributing editor Dr. Nona Wilson of St. Cloud State University about the needs and counseling of gifted children in the school setting. Runtime 40:40
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS066 - Clinical Hypnosis w/ Dr. Chris Faiver
item.description: Dr. Chris Faiver of John Carroll University speaks with contributing editor Laura Bruneau, MEd., LPCC-S about using clinical hypnosis as a therapeutic tool for mental health issues. Runtime 28:41
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS065 - Counseling from a Bahamian Perspective w/ Mr. Vicente Roberts, M.A.
item.description: Mr. Vicente Roberts, M.A. speaks about the profession of counseling in The Bahamas with CAS Editor, Dr. Marty Jencius of Kent State University. Mr. Roberts is a Counselor II at The College of The Bahamas and discusses assessing college student stress, college counseling centers, and the future of counseling in The Bahamas. Runtime 41:14
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS064 - Teaching Group Work w/ Dr. Betsy J. Page
item.description: Dr. Betsy J. Page of Kent State University speaks with CAS Editor Dr. Marty Jencius about teaching group work. Dr. Page focuses on how to plan for the course and what components go into her teaching of group work. Runtime 32:37
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS063 - Digital Music in Mental Health Services - StudioHope.org w/ David Palomo, M.A.
item.description: David Palomo, M.A. speaks with CAS Editor Dr. Marty Jencius (Kent State University) about The Studio Hope Project, a program that uses digital music creation as an adjunct for working with at-risk youth. This podcast has samples of some of the participant's music. Runtime 29:17
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS062 - Child-centered Play Therapy w/ Dr. Phyllis Post
item.description: Dr. Phyllis Post speaks with CAS Contributing Editor Dr. Clarrice Rapisarda (both of The University of North Carolina - Charlotte) regarding a general introduction to child-centered play therapy. Runtime 51:40
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS061 - Middle School Counseling w/ Karen Konopik, MS
item.description: Karen Konopik-Bishop, MS, a middle school counselor at Lewis & Clark Middle School in Omaha, Nebraska speaks with CAS Associate Editor Dr. Theresa O'Halloran regarding the roles and activities of middle school counselors. Runtime 33:46
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS060 - Triadic Supervision w/ Drs. Lenoir Gillam and Michael L. Baltimore
item.description: Drs. Lenoir Gillam and Michael L. Baltimore speak with CAS Contributing Editor Dr. Tom Hackett (all of Columbus State University) regarding the use of triadic supervision with counselor trainees. Runtime 59:08
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS059 - Adolescent Depression w/ Dr. John McCarthy
item.description: Dr. John McCarthy speaks with CAS Contributing Editor Dr. Kimberly J. Desmond (both of Indiana University of Pennsylvania) regarding assessment and intervention in adolescent depression. Runtime 42:29
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS058 - Black Male Authenticity w/ Dr. Cyrus M. Ellis
item.description: Dr. Cyrus M. Ellis speaks with CAS Contributing Editor Dr. Shannon Dermer (both of Governors State University) regarding Black male authenticity and its impact in counseling. Runtime 51:21
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS057 - Therapeutic Horseback Riding w/ staff of Pegasus Farm
item.description: The staff of Pegasus Farm speaks with CAS Contributing Editor Dr. Betsy Page about therapeutic horseback riding. Runtime 25:49
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS056 - Working with Children in Family Therapy w/ Dr. Catherine Ford Sori
item.description: Dr. Catherine Ford Sori speaks about working with children in family therapy to CAS Contributing Editor Dr. Shannon Dermer. Runtime 41:20
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS055 - Non-Linear Supervision Using Innovative Technology w/ Dr. Claire J. Dandeneau & Dr. Lorraine J. Guth
item.description: Dr. Claire J. Dandeneau and Dr. Lorraine J Guth of Indiana University of Pennsylvania speak with CAS Contributing Editor Dr. Kimberly J. Desmond about new digital recording technology which permits them to provide counselor trainees with innovative supervision opportunities. Runtime 50:13
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS054 - Spirituality in Counseling w/ Dr. Tracey E. Robert
item.description: Dr. Tracey E. Robert of Fairfield University speaks about spirituality in counseling using the ASERVIC spirituality competencies with CAS Contributing Editor Dr. Edina Renfro-Michel. Runtime 36:03
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS053 - Creativity in Counselor Education w/ Dr. Geoffrey G. Yager
item.description: Dr. Geoffrey G. Yager speaks with CAS Associate Editor Dr. Theresa O'Halloran about storytelling and creativity in counselor training. Runtime 49:21
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS052 - Preparing for a Flu Pandemic w/ Dave Bentz, Portage Co. (Ohio) Health Educator
item.description: Dave Bentz, a Portage County Ohio Health Educator, speaks with CAS Contributing Editor Dr. Betsy Page about how we can prepare for a flu pandemic. Runtime 21:58
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS051 - Counselors Address Holiday Stress w/ Dr. Pat Haines and Pat Tabbara, M.Ed.
item.description: Dr. Pat Haines and Pat Tabbara, M.Ed. (both from Townhall II Counseling Center) speak with CAS Editor Dr. Marty Jencius about assisting clients with holiday stress. Runtime 36:52
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS050 - Work Success and Work Adjustment w/ Dr. Larry D. Burlew
item.description: Dr. Larry D. Burlew speaks with CAS Contributing editor Dr. Edina Renfro-Michel (both from Montclair State University) about Dr. Burlew's Model of Organizational (Work) Life Runtime 41:35
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS049 - Counseling Veterans with PTSD w/ Dr. Gwendolyn Newsome
item.description: Dr. Gwendolyn Newsome speaks with CAS Contributing editor Dr. Chadwick Royal (both from North Carolina Central University) about counseling veterans with post-traumatic stress disorder. Runtime 33:31
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS048 - The Person Centered Approach in Counseling w/ Dr. Wade Hannon
item.description: Dr. Wade Hannon speaks with CAS Contributing editor Dr. Jill Nelson (both from North Dakota State University) about the Person Centered approach in counseling. Runtime 28:59
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS047 - Integrating Nutrition and Exercise with School Counseling w/ Dr. Verna Oliva-Flemming
item.description: Dr. Verna Oliva-Flemming speaks with CAS Contributing editor Edina Renfro-Michel (both from Montclair State University) about her work integrating nutrition and exercise into school counseling. Runtime 26:32

item.description: Dr. Cynthia Osborn speaks about the importance of professional identity development in counselors with CAS contributing editor Rachel Hoffman.ÃÂÃÂ Runtime 29:40

item.title: CAS045 - School Counseling Peer Supervision using Reflective Teams w/ Dr. Tarrell Portman
item.description: Dr. Tarrell Portman speaks about her experiences with school counseling peer supervision using reflective teams with CAS associate editor Dr. Theresa O'Halloran.ÃÂÃÂ Runtime 34:10

item.title: CAS044 - Becoming a Forensic Evaluator w/ Dr. Agatha Parks-Savage
item.description: Dr. Agatha Parks-Savage, LPC, RN, speaks with contributing editor, Dr. Mark Rehfuss of Regent University, about her experiences with the process of becoming certified as a Forensic Evaluator. Runtime 23:11
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS043 - Forensic interviewing in child sexual abuse cases w/ Dr. Sacky Holdiness
item.description: Dr. Sacky Holdiness, LPC, NCC speaks with contributing editor, Dr. Edina Renfro-Michel of Montclair State University, about her role in performing forensic evaluations with children who have been sexually abused.ÃÂÃÂ Runtime 38:43
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS042 - Counseling clients with HIV/AIDS w/ Dr. Paula Britton
item.description: Dr. Paula Britton of John Carroll University speaks with contributing editor, Laura Bruneau of Kent State University, about working with clients with HIV/ AIDS. This interview addresses ethical, clinical, and multicultural issues when working with this population. Runtime 44:56
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS041 - School Re-entry of Acquired Spinal Cord Injury Patients w/ Ms. Jacqueline M. Stanton, LPC, CRC
item.description: Ms. Jacqueline M. Stanton, LPC, CRC speaks with CAS Editor Dr. Marty Jencius about how counselors can assist acquired spinal cord injury patients in their re-entry into the school system. Runtime 36:02
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS040 - Cuban / Floridian Response to Hurricane Stress w/ Dr. Edward E. Moody
item.description: Dr. Edward E. Moody speaks with CAS Contributing Editor Dr. Chadwick Royal (both from North Carolina Central University) about his work in Cuba and Florida with victims of hurricanes and the stress they experience. Runtime 25:51
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS039 - Development of Theoretical Orientation and Use of Theories w/ Drs. Walter Breaux, III and Michael L. Baltimore
item.description: Drs. Walter Breaux III and Michael Baltimore speak with Dr. Tom Hackett (all from Columbus State University) about theoretical orientation for counselors in training and application to practice. Runtime 44:21
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS038 - Elder Issues w/ Ms. Patty Shirmbeck
item.description: Ms. Patty Shirmbeck, Eldercare Division Director of the Eastern Nebraska Office on Aging, speaks about elder issues with CAS Contributing Editor, Dr. Theresa O'Halloran. Runtime 34:54
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS037 - Including Wellness in Counseling w/ Dr. Paul Granello
item.description: Dr. Paul Granello of The Ohio State University speaks about introducing the wellness paradigm into counseling practice with CAS Editor, Dr. Marty Jencius. Runtime 45:00
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS036 - Mediation: Principles and Practices w/ Jacqueline N. Font - Guzman, M.H.A., J.D.
item.description: Jacqueline N. Font - Guzman, M.H.A., J.D. speaks with CAS Contributing Editor Dr. Theresa O'Halloran about the principles and practices of mediation as a career option for trained counselors. Runtime 44:16
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS035 - Reasons Counselors Use Assessments w/ Dr. Rich Lambert
item.description: Dr. Rich Lambert from the University of North Carolina at Charlotte discusses how a counselor's role is enhanced by using assessments in working in schools with CAS Contributing Editor Dr. Clarice Rapisarda. Runtime 22:39
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS034 - Creating a GLBT Supportive School w/ Dr. Steve Rainey
item.description: Dr. Steve Rainey from Kent State University discusses how to create a supportive school environment for Gay, Lesbian, Bisexual and Transgendered students with CAS Editor Dr. Marty Jencius. Runtime 43:38
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS033 - The Continuum of Care in Treatment of Adolescents w/ Dennis G. Vollmer, MHD, PLMHP
item.description: Dennis G. Vollmer MHD, PLMHP, Director of the Intensive Residential Treatment Center at Father Flanagan's Boys Home, speaks about the Continuum of Care in Treatment of Adolescents with CAS Contributing Editor Dr. Theresa O'Halloran. Runtime 37:26
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.description: Dr. Jason McGlothlin speaks about working with suicidal clients with CAS Editor Dr. Marty Jencius. Runtime 43:37
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.description: Dr. Tommie Radd speaks about her self-concept development model with CAS Contributing Editor Dr. Theresa O'Halloran. Runtime 42:07
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.description: M. Fulya Kurter, Director of Career Services for Bahcesehir University in Istanbul Turkey speaks about career services and trends in career development in Turkey with Dr. Marty Jencius. Runtime 40:00
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.description: Dr. Stephen Guinta speaks about his training and practice related to custody evaluation interviewing with Dr. James Messina. Runtime 37:33
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS028 - Professional Writing and Creativity w/ Dr. Sam Gladding
item.description: Dr. Sam Gladding speaks about his professional writing in counseling and creativity as interviewed by Dr. Jeffrey Freiden. Runtime 24:39
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS027 - Counseling Men w/ Dr. Jeffrey Smith
item.description: Dr. Jeffrey Smith is interviewed by Dr. Theresa O'Halloran about issues when counseling men. Runtime 52:22
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS026 - Narrative Therapy w/ Dr. Donald Bubenzer
item.description: Dr. Donald Bubenzer is interviewed by Tom Newman, MAEd. LPCC (both of Kent State University) about the theory and practice of Narrative Therapy. Runtime 45:22
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS025 - Employee Assistance Counseling w/ Maureen O'Donnell, MA, LMHP
item.description: Dr. Theresa O'Halloran interviews Maureen O'Donnell, MA, LMHP from Arbor Family Counseling about Employee Assistance Counseling. Runtime 33:05
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS024 - Counseling Clients with Multiple Sclerosis w/ Dr. Phillip Rumrill
item.description: Dr. Phillip Rumrill, Professor of Rehabilitation and Dr. Betsy Page (both of Kent State University) discuss clients with multiple sclerosis, its impact on the mind and body and resources for counselors working with MS clients. Runtime 41:18
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS023 - Remediation and Dismissal of a Counseling Student w/ Dr. Rip McAdams
item.description: Dr. Rip McAdams speaks with Christopher D. Schmidt (both from William and Mary) about a counseling program's experience with remediation, dismissal, and intricate challenges of a court case. They explore the dilemma counselor educator's face when they are mandated to dismiss students judged to be unfit but at the same time risk legal action in doing so. Runtime 1:04:53
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS022 - Psychodynamic Psychotherapy w/ Dr. Dan Rose
item.description: Dr. Dan Rose, Director of the Counseling Center at Columbus State University speaks about psychodynamic psychotherapy with CAS Contributing Editor Dr/ Michael L. Baltimore. Runtime 44:09
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS021 - Online Counselor Education w/ Dr. Mark Manzanares
item.description: Dr. Mark Manzanares of Adams State College speaks about developing an online counselor education program with CAS contributing editor Dr. Theresa O' Halloran. Runtime 44:17
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS020 - Consultation: Creating School-Based Interventions w/ Dr. Don Dinkmeyer Jr.
item.description: Dr. Don Dinkmeyer Jr. speaks about his latest book on consultation in the schools with contributing editor Dr. Tammy Shaffer. Runtime 36:18
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS019 - Inclusivity in Multicultural Counseling w/ Dr. Walter Breaux III
item.description: Dr. Walter Breaux III speaks with CAS Contributing editor Dr. Lenoir Gillam (both of Columbus State University) regarding the process of inclusivity in multicultural counseling. Runtime 26:45
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS018 - At-risk Youth and Home-based Treatment w/ Ms. Mary Beth Towell, LPCC
item.description: Mary Beth Towell, MA, LPCC and co-executive director of Summit Family Solutions speaks with contributing editor Tom Newman regarding home-based treatment strategies for at-risk youth. Runtime 37:57
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS017 - Reflections on the American School Counselor Association w/ Ms. Barbara Blackburn, ASCA President
item.description: Ms. Barbara Blackburn, current president of the American School Counselor Association, speaks with Dr. Jeffrey Freiden about her reflections on the impact of school counselors and ASCA professional affiliation. Runtime 31:42
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS016 - Understanding Clients with Pagan Beliefs w/ Mr. Dick Moons
item.description: Mr. Dick Moons, founding member of the Columbia, South Carolina area chapter of the Covenant of Unitarian Universalist Pagans is interviewed by Ms. Jennifer Gilmore, LPC, LMFT about counseling considerations when working with pagan clients. Runtime 47:01
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS015 - Reflections on the American Counseling Association w/ Mr. Richard Yep, Executive Director
item.description: Mr. Richard Yep, Executive Director of the American Counseling Association speaks with CAS Contributing Editor Dr. Jeffrey Freiden regarding the benefit for counselors in having a professional affiliation with ACA. This interview took place during the 2006 ACA World Conference in Montreal. Runtime 23:03
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS014 - The Cross-Cultural School Counselor w/ Ms. Glinda Rawls
item.description: Ms. Glinda Rawls speaks with CAS Contributing Editor Dr. Delila Owens of Wayne State University about the challenges becoming a cross-cultural school counselor. Runtime 16:13
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS013 - University Counseling Centers w/ Dr. Jason L. Miller
item.description: Dr. Jason L. Miller, Director of the Counseling and Human Development Center at Kent State University, speaks with CAS Editor Dr. Marty Jencius about the challenges of running a university counseling center. Runtime 38:26
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS012 - Grief Counseling w/ Dr. Jane Bissler
item.description: Dr. Jane Bissler discusses grief counseling for individuals, couples, families and groups with our contributing editor Dr. Betsy J. Page of Kent State University. Runtime 48:28
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS011 - Ethical Issues in Rural Counseling w/ Dr. Rex Filer
item.description: Dr. Rex Filer speaks about ethical issues when counseling in rural settings with contributing editor Dr. Theresa O'Halloran, both of Adams State College. Runtime 34:58
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS010 - CACREP and the CACREP Standards Revision Process w/ Dr. Jack Culbreth
item.description: Dr. Jack Culbreth dialogues with Dr. Clarrice Rapisarda, both of The University of North Carolina - Charlotte, regarding CACREP standards and the current standards revision process. Dr. Culbreth is the current Chair of the CACREP Board of Directors. Runtime 40:40
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS009 - The Historical Perspective on the field of Mental Health Counseling w/ Dr. James Messina
item.description: Dr. James Messina speaks about his history with the formation of mental health counseling as a licensed profession. Dr. Stephen Guinta dialogues with Dr. Messina about his role as co-founder of the American Mental Health Counseling Association and his efforts on behalf of professional counselor licensure. Runtime 32:04
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS008 - Crisis Training for School Counselors w/ Dr. Julia Y. Porter
item.description: Dr. Julia Y. Porter of Mississippi State University speaks about school counselors and their need for training in crisis counseling. Dr. Darren Wozny obtains Dr. Porter's perspective on how counselor education programs currently train school counselors in the area of crisis counseling. Runtime 31:03
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS007 - Bullying: Intervention Strategies for the Victim and Bully w/ Dr. Walter B. Roberts
item.description: Dr. Walter B. Roberts speaks about bullying and strategies counselors can use for working with both the victim and the bully. Dr. Roberts has recently published "Bullying From Both Sides: Strategic Interventions for Working With Bullies & Victims" and is interviewed by contributing editor, Dr. Nona L. Wilson. Runtime 53:07
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS006 - International Initiatives in Counselor Education w/ Dr. Richard James
item.description: Dr. Lemuel W. Watson, Professor of Higher Education and Chair of the Department of Counseling, Adult, and Higher Education at Northern Illinois University speaks with contributing editor, Dr. Leann Wyrick-Morgan about international initiatives in their department. Runtime 30:22
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS005 - Ecosystemic Crisis Management w/ Dr. Richard James
item.description: Dr. Richard James, The Crader Professor of Education at The University of Memphis, discusses his work and expertise in Ecosystemic Crisis Management with contributing editor Dr. Jeffrey Freiden. Ecosystemic Crisis Management is relevant for counselor working with the tragedy of hurricane Katrina and potential threats like the Avian flu epidemic. Runtime 28:24
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS004 - Training and Process Issues in Clinical Supervision w/ Dr. Michael L. Baltimore
item.description: Dr. Michael L. Baltimore a Professor at Columbus State University discusses training and process issues in clinical supervision. Contributing editor Dr. Richard P. Long speaks with Dr. Baltimore about clinical issues supervisors should know. Dr. Baltimore is the co-author of "Clinical supervisor training: An interactive CD-ROM training program for the helping professions". Runtime 21:58
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS003 - Counseling with Native American/Alaskan Natives w/ Dr. John J. Peregoy
item.description: Dr. John J. Peregoy an Assistant Professor at Morehead State University speaks with contributing editor Edina Renfro-Michel regarding counseling with Native American/Alaskan Native clients. Dr. Peregoy is the current president of the Society of Indian Psychologists. Runtime 39:15
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS002 - Bilingual Counseling w/ Dr. Clarrice Rapisarda
item.description: Dr. Clarrice Rapisarda of The University of North Carolina - Charlotte covers the topic of bilingual counseling and the use of translators in the counseling session. The interview was done by Dr. Marty Jencius of Kent State University. Runtime 27:46
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS001 - Transcultural Counseling w/ Dr. John McFadden
item.description: Dr. John McFadden covers the topic of Transcultural Counseling and the Stylistic Model. The interview was done by Dr. Marty Jencius of Kent State University in October of 2005 while at the South Carolina Society for Adlerian Psychology Conference. Runtime 38:56
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)

item.title: CAS000 - CounselorAudioSource.Net Promo
item.description: This is a short promo for CounselorAudioSource.Net for use by other podcastors. Runtime 00:30
item.author: editor@counseloraudiosource.net (Dr. Marty Jencius)
